intro: Sericanthe jacfelicis, commonly known as the golden star hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-centered flowers with red or orange petals. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Sericanthe jacfelicis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
